name: jdbcsql
short_description:
jdbcsql is a small command-line tool written in JAVA and can be used on all platforms, for which JRE 8 is available. To connect to a specific DBMS the tool uses its JDBC driver. In the version I've posted for download the following DBMS are configured: mysql, oracle, postgresql. The result of the executed query ‘select’ is displayed on stdout in CSV format complying with rfc4180. When there is an error the tool stops with exit code 1 and the error message is output on stderr.  jdbcsql is created with a main purpose to be used in shell-scripts.
Relatively easy to configurate, this tool is suitable for queries ‘select’, ‘update’ and ‘delete’. I think that is not suitable for a large number of requests, like 'insert'.
